description: {"blocks":[{"key":"febvc","text":"This protocol introduces a streamlined approach for concurrent sampling for endogenous and microbial ancient DNA (aDNA) and stable isotopes (particularly, but not exclusively, enamel sampling for strontium isotope analysis) from a single archaeological tooth. By combining sampling strategies into a single workflow, the protocol eliminates the risk of inadvertently sampling different individuals. It reduces the need for multiple sampling rounds, optimises the use of each sample, and eliminates the need to collect multiple samples for different analyses. Additionally, it minimises logistical complexity by reducing shipments between institutions and the risk of sample loss during transit. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"135fi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1orqq","text":"1. All new samples in their original (sample) bags must be cleaned on all sides using diluted bleach and then UV-irradiated for  before further use. Be careful when cleaning the bags to avoid removing any sample information/markings on the sample bag. If necessary, document the sample bag (e.g., by photographing it) before decontamination to preserve important information.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":127,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8ep9t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bnek7","text":"2. In the meantime, prepare new, clean, correctly labelled plastic bags and A4 sheets of paper (one per sample). Each sheet should be clearly labelled with the sample ID written top centre.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6p3fs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c604e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8b067","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cr4fq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dgatf","text":"3. Once the new samples have been decontaminated, each sample must be photographed as follows:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":70,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6c9kp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"av2fb","text":"Position the tooth (removed from the decontaminated original plastic bag) on the pre-prepared A4 sheet with the sample ID written at the top. Use forceps/pliers or a piece of aluminium foil to handle the tooth. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dsi52","text":"Place a scale/ruler directly below the tooth.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2caeb","text":"Add the original sample label or the original sample bag beneath the scale/ruler to ensure that both the original grave ID and the newly given sample ID are visible in the photograph.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dos67","text":"Take one photo showing all components (new sample ID, tooth, scale/ruler, original sample label/sample bag).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"alhk5","text":"Take a second, close-up photograph that includes only the new sample ID, the tooth, and the scale/ruler (excluding the original label or bag).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2udiv","text":"Rotate the tooth 180° along its vertical axis using forceps/pliers or a piece of aluminium foil, and repeat for this side. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f6jm7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c5sck","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"73fss","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"u2se","text":"Once the tooth has been photographed from both sides, place it into one of the newly prepared, labelled plastic bags using forceps/pliers or a piece of aluminium foil. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1nbfa","text":"Dispose of the A4 sheet with the sample ID, the old sample bag (including any old labels), and the aluminium foil. If forceps/pliers were used, these must be decontaminated before handling the next sample. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dah1o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"hy79s","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"23A386A7FE0411EDB9BC0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"on each side","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":35,"offset":0,"style":"bold"},{"length":57,"offset":54,"style":"italic"},{"length":27,"offset":140,"style":"italic"}],"key":"4qgj5","text":"Avoid touching the tooth directly! Place the weighing paper in the centre of the weighing scale and tare (zero out) its weight.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f1meb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9tk5k","text":"3. Carefully pour enough powder for the main sample onto the paper (ideally   ). Record the weight, then transfer the powder into the second labelled tube and place aside. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":76,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4f48q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6c0f6","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"58sqs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"687bm","text":"4. Pour the remaining (back-up) powder onto the weighing paper, record the weight, and transfer it back into the labelled tube. This back-up sample should be no less than   .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":171,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"50","error":false,"guid":"622CC2F0013111EEB4752F4ECF6A3587","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":5}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":5,"offset":0,"style":"italic"},{"length":3,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"60r4","text":"Tip: If the powder is statically charged, it can be difficult to remove from the tube. Wiping the tube down with a wet paper towel can help.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"7","error":false,"guid":"C7620860013111EEB4752F4ECF6A3587","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":5}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a08ch","text":"Post-DNA sampling \u0026 Cleaning ","type":"align-center","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"86l0v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cg1g","text":"1. Carefully place the roots back into the plastic bag using a piece of aluminium foil or pliers, then remove from the workstation. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ecckm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"40bv0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dhic6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"daf3h","text":"2. Optional if enamel is sampled: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":34}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"27ec","text":"Place the crown/crown pieces, or enamel pieces (depending on condition of the crown after separation) into a glass vial filled with deionised water. (Tip: not all pieces of the crown need to be placed in deionised water—only enough to extract the desired amount of enamel powder). If enamel is not sampled, place the crown back into the plastic bag.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":219},{"style":"italic","offset":225,"length":124},{"style":"bold","offset":150,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1uv12","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"345j","text":"3. Place the round carbide bur, pliers, and any other tools used during the process into the prepared container with diluted commercial bleach solution (1:10) for decontamination. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c4okk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3j2po","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"81mo7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ec6ta","text":"4. Dispose of any disposable equipment (e.g., aluminium foil, paper, weighing paper, paper plates) along with your gloves, ideally wrapping the material inside your gloves before disposal.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8tfbe","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":2,"offset":164,"style":"sup"}],"key":"fmsvu","text":"Additional powder or the entire roots can be used for further analyses. For example, collagen can be extracted from either the powder or the roots for radiocarbon (14C) or stable isotope analyses (e.g., Carbon, Nitrogen, Sulphur). Sample amounts may vary depending on the processing lab, but 300-400mg is usually required for collagen extraction.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"a15us","text":"Once the tools have been in the bleach solution for an adequate amount of time, ensure that metal utensils are rinsed with UV-treated Reverse Osmosis water to remove any residual bleach and prevent corrosion.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bross","text":"At this point, a new sample can be started: Refer back to Step 3.2. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":58,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"bng5m","text":"CHANGE GLOVES","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"64cad","text":"Record the sample weights on the labelled tubes using a waterproof pen, and also note them on a separate sheet of paper. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2csua","text":"Once all teeth from one site have been sampled, make sure to take photos from all sides on a neutral background with a scale/ruler (refer back to Section 1: Pre-Sampling Documentation).  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":156,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1jueo","text":"Required Materials","type":"align-center","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d27e2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cria6","text":"DNA Exitus Plus","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"efcgh","text":"Diluted commercial bleach solution (1:10) (diluted with UV-irradiated Reverse Osmosis water)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6eldm","text":"Polyethylene clear plastic bags","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cs65h","text":"A4 paper","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"frn9m","text":"Waterproof pen","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3cdra","text":"Aluminium foil","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"25bt1","text":"Forceps/Pliers","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"86e7j","text":"Paper towels","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3dqh7","text":"Scale/Ruler","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"53ar6","text":"Camera ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dn683","text":"Once all teeth from one site have been sampled, make sure to take photos from all sides on a neutral background with a scale/ruler (refer back to Section 1: Pre-Sampling Documentation). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4i0cj","text":"Change gloves after each sample to avoid contamination. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cbtre","text":"All individual sample bags should then be placed into a single collective bag labelled with the site code. Additionally, the collective bag should be labelled to indicate whether the bags (and later the samples - see Section 2) have undergone UV-irradiation (e.g. \u003cSite Code\u003e, UV bags ‱,  UV samples). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":217,"length":9},{"style":"italic","offset":258,"length":43}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":285,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e2lrc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1qpuk","text":"If the process needs to be paused at this stage, place the bag containing the samples into a decontaminated, sealed container. You may then resume the procedure at a later time.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"C49247E39D7811EE9FCB0A58A9FEAC02","name":":heavy_check_mark:"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dtamh","text":"Preparation for decontamination after sampling","type":"align-center","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":46}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bjet6","text":"","type":"align-center","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"gde5","text":"1. Prepare one plastic tub/container with diluted commercial bleach solution (1:10) away from the working bench. This will be used to submerge all tools after sampling.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"31lep","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e8idn","text":"2. Place a UV-irradiated toothbrush into the bleach solution (1:10) tub, to be used later for cleaning the tools.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"54sak","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9l7br","text":"3. Prepare a smaller plastic tub/container with UV-treated Reverse Osmosis water, also away from the working bench. This will be used to rinse the tools after bleach submersion, helping to prevent corrosion.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"boeuu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"deh1d","text":"4. Set up a drying area with paper towels, where tools can be left to dry after decontamination.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ee9hd","text":"CHANGE GLOVES","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7gbup","text":"At the end of the sampling day, place all portable equipment in a UV chamber and irradiate for several hours overnight. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3bmnf","text":"CHANGE GLOVES","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"evu64","text":"At this point, a new sample can be started: Refer back to Step 3.2.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":58,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
